title: What if Trundle's pillar had another functionality ?
body:
If cast on {{champion:48}}  in Frozen Domain, he breaks free from immobilizing effects. 

Just a cool side effect utility that would be rarely used, like {{champion:27}}'s fling into the mega adhesive.

replies.body: You should be able to climb your own pillar and throw snowballs from it at enemies. :p

Or if he casts his pillar in the domain on an enemy it could knock them up for 1ish seconds
it's more useful and it allows "strategic diversity"

And clear "counter play" opportunities as frozen domain is telegraphed.

jk, not sure if the counterplay is enough but I like the idea.

Make the pillar have a 2 second cool down if cast inside Frozen Domain :3

Exactly my point.

Combined with the rest of his kit he gave zero fucks about a frontline.

I really disagree, I believe the pillar is Trundle's strongest spell. Using it on yourself, or even if this is applicable on an ally.

Isn't as good as throwing it on 3 enemies.

I thought it made some sense since the pillar knocks the target up/aside, it could free an allied target from immobilizes.

Being able to break CC at will on a 6.6 second cooldown. You don't see how that could be broken? Especially on a champion like Trundle who basically already destroys anything that doesn't have extreme mobility.

... I'd like to point out 6.6 cooldown is with 40% CDR.

Meaning likely {{item:3110}} + {{item:3065}} + [ Runes/Masteries/{{item:3172}}  ]  which is at a point in the game where {{champion:48}}'s teamfighting damage becomes crap, and so saving himself from immobilizes won't mean much.

If it's dueling you're worried about, aka split pushing. He definitely isn't {{champion:24}}, and building CDR doesn't help him duel.

Speaking as a trundle main (top lane, so I have more luxury to build damage items, blahblahblah) Trundle has amazing teamfight damage. His natural steroids alone give him really strong DPS, and when combined with his in-combat sustain and one or two damage items, he can put in a lot of work. And if you're building full tank, then yeah, your damage will obviously fall off super late, but you can still shred down the enemy frontline, because that's what trundle was built for.

On a related note, CDR helps anyone with a damage spell out in a duel, because more spell cooldowns=more damage.

I reiterate: BREAKING CC AT WILL. He'd be borderline impossible to shut down. Every time you CC him, he'd be like "LOLNOPE"

{{item:3707}} {{item:3025}} {{item:3071}} {{item:3142}} All give CDR AND damage so the idea that he has to give up significant damage to get CDR is - to be frank - bullshit.

{{item:3134}} and {{item:3065}} are even core on him, meaning he'll always have at least 20% CDR at a minimum once he hits full build.

Well, I didn't mean that you could cast it while CC'd if you thought that was the case.

Let me give you a very close comparison, so you'd think of the situation from a different angle.

This mechanic is a {{champion:41}} W at best.

What you're suggesting is building {{champion:48}} AD CD to take advantage of it's low CD at 40%.

Check what happens to {{champion:41}} when he builds full crit in fights.

{{champion:48}}'s Q does not crit the way GP's does.

Evaluate the situation.

{{champion:48}} will explode in fights, possibly without even landing 1 Q because he has no range. He just used his best ranged spell on himself.
Now you're comparing CDR to crit?

Which begs the question: Why should this functionality be added?
What if it was able to make his domain also have the slowing effect to a lesser degree.
A slow field that big would be, for want of a better term, crazy overpowered. You're literally talking about slowing an entire team while also giving yourself 3 massive steroids.

how about it increases your MS whenever you move towards your ice pillar?

althought it would be nice to have the pillar actually interacting with his kit, sorta like Singed's glue with his fling
I think pillar is fine as-is, it really doesn't need any buffs.
I'd prefer to see the pillar reduce in CD if placed in the domain, rather than give him a free cleanse, which is kinda BS given all the stuff the pillar already does. Make the effect make sense.
My thoughts? Anything is a dildo if you're brave enough.
